replies.body: http://orig01.deviantart.net/ece2/f/2016/047/a/3/i_m_a_simple_man_i_see_rwby__i_press_like_by_maronmario-d9s03h2.jpg

Is this on Netflix or Hulu by chance?

Also is RWBY short for something or is that the actual title.

It's on YouTube and Crunchyroll, and I think one other site I can't remember


RWBY is the actual title but it's short for Ruby Weiss Blake Yang, which are the names of the main characters
(take my answer with a grain of salt since I'm new to the series)

You are correct, but also each of thier names are also that of thier respective color, Red/White/Black/Yellow. the site you are refering to is Roosterteeth.com which is the company's site, they have all the series they do there.

also welcome to the rwby cult, we have been expecting you.
It's fucking fantastic though
RWBY is also available on Netflix, but only Volume 1 and 2

I don't want to sound like a douche but...

What is the appeal of that show anyways?  All I see is garish 3d anime imitation...

There are so many characters its hard not tk find one you like. They are almost all memorable. The plot is pretty good, the world it sets up is cool. And there are guns and swords, monsters, and badass abilities.

Also why do people always think its not? Its just American. While anime is a Japanese term it can be applied to many different shows. And personally I dont give a crap if its "anime" or not, I like watching it, so what does it matter? Im not talking at you about this, just generalizing.

Oh and you can ship just about anyone.

well it is anime regardless of what people say cause in japan anime stands for animation and it means every form of animation and regardless of where its from so regardless its anime no matter what :D

Gunchucks.
http://i.imgur.com/EO7AUKu.jpg?noredirect
http://img04.deviantart.net/d30f/i/2014/079/c/7/eyes_off_the_gunchucks_by_atsusakaneytza-d7b04kb.png
The writing, honestly.
Yeah, a lot of people are offput by the animation but the brand of humor in it is too enjoyable to let that bother me.

Fair criticism.  The animation, especially early on where most of the gifs on this forum come from, was **really** weak.  It's the attention to detail in fight scenes and the constant overlay of omfsa%%%hatwasfingadorable that the whole show has woven into it that sold me.

But you're right, that won't make a good show.  What you aren't seeing here is pretty much anything from Volume 3.  Right from the start, the makers of the show planned to use the first three seasons to set up an idea of what the show was, then **_turn it on it's head._**  From here on?  We're excited to see where the show goes, because right now everything's up for grabs.  There's so many directions the writing could go, and the animation quality is [through the roof now](https://twitter.com/RoosterTeeth/status/780428833983868932).

TL;DR This meme is from Volume 1, episode 8 (yes I know that off the top of my head don't judge me) and the show has come a long way since in both writing and animation.
Hope you won't be upset that I dont plan to watch it even after you explained all that to me xD

Oh, no worries.  It's definitely not for everyone.

But really though, it would just suck to upset some random stranger on the internet with no impact on your daily life or ranked games. ;)
good writing with strong characters and world building.
Honest the animation deterred me at first but then i got to watch it and fell in love

> Us: \*Everyone dies 3 times solo for inexplicable reasons\*
> That one guy: "Group please."
> Me: "Oh yeah, cause now we'll DEFINITELY win teamfights."

-
> Us: \*Sees the enemy team has brutal synergy.\*
> That one guy: "They're grouping. Group please."
> Me: "I... wut..."

-
> Us: \*Sees we have 2 glass cannon push/sieger champions and the other team has 3 tanks\*
> That one guy: "Tanks OP. Group please."
> Me: "I'm not even gonna say anything this time."

-
> Us: \*Sees we lack tactical decisions.\*
> That one guy: "Group please."
> Me: "Did you write that down first, or was it off the top off your head?"

-
> Us: \*Sees we are in a League of Legends game.\*
> That one guy: "Group please."
> Me: "Are you that robot from every other game?"
When your bot team tries to 2v2 the enemy bot team, but your adc and support is 2 levels behind them.

While I do think it's gotten much better compared to what it was (actual stand in models as opposed to silhouettes) I wouldn't go so far as to call it "through the roof" after all.  They still haven't figured out a running animation that doesn't make it look like the characters are skating.
